label: ArcadeEngineApi
description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the engine API.

tools.name: AuthorizeUserToolAccess
tools.description:
Authorize a user to access a specific tool.

This tool authorizes a user for a specific tool by its name. It should be called when a user needs permission to access a specific tool. The tool returns the authorization status.

parameters.name: tool_name_for_authorization
parameters.description: Specify the name of the tool to authorize the user for access.

parameters.name: redirect_uri_after_authorization
parameters.description: Optional URI to redirect the user after authorization.

parameters.name: tool_version
parameters.description: Specify the tool version to authorize. If not provided, any version will be used.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for a user. Required only when using an API key for authorization.

tools.name: AuthorizeWorker
tools.description:
Authorize a worker based on their ID.

This tool is used to verify and authorize a worker by their ID. It should be called when it's necessary to check if a worker has the appropriate permissions or status to perform certain tasks.

parameters.name: worker_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the worker to be authorized.

tools.name: CheckArcadeEngineHealth
tools.description:
Check the health status of the Arcade Engine.

Use this tool to verify if the Arcade Engine service is currently healthy and operational.

tools.name: CheckAuthStatus
tools.description:
Verify the ongoing authorization status of a tool.

Use this tool to check the status of an ongoing authorization process for a specific tool. Ideal for monitoring when an authorization completes or times out.

parameters.name: authorization_id
parameters.description: The unique ID for the authorization process to check its status.

parameters.name: timeout_in_seconds
parameters.description: Specify the timeout duration in seconds. Maximum allowed is 59 seconds.

tools.name: CreateWorker
tools.description:
Create a new worker in the system.

This tool is used to add a new worker to the system. It should be called when there's a need to register a new worker.

parameters.name: worker_id
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the worker to be created. It should be a string.

parameters.name: enable_worker
parameters.description: Set to true to enable the new worker upon creation, or false to keep it disabled.

parameters.name: http_retry_attempts
parameters.description: Number of retry attempts for HTTP requests if a failure occurs.

parameters.name: http_secret_key
parameters.description: A secret key used for HTTP authentication and authorization. It should be a secure string provided by the service.

parameters.name: http_timeout_seconds
parameters.description: The timeout duration for the HTTP connection, specified in seconds. This defines how long the system should wait for the HTTP request to complete before timing out.

parameters.name: mcp_retry_attempts
parameters.description: Specifies the number of retry attempts for MCP connections. Provide an integer value to define how many times the system should retry a connection if it fails.

parameters.name: mcp_timeout_duration
parameters.description: The timeout duration for MCP operations in seconds. Must be an integer value.

parameters.name: worker_http_uri
parameters.description: The HTTP URI for the worker's endpoint. This expects a valid URL string that specifies where the worker's service can be accessed.

parameters.name: worker_resource_uri
parameters.description: The URI for the worker's resource location or service endpoint. Provide the full URI as a string.

parameters.name: worker_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of worker to be created. It should be a string indicating the category or role of the worker.

tools.name: DeleteAuthProvider
tools.description:
Delete a specific auth provider by ID.

This tool deletes a specified authentication provider using its ID. It should be called when you need to remove an auth provider from the system.

parameters.name: auth_provider_id
parameters.description: The ID of the authentication provider to delete.

tools.name: DeleteMcpEndpoint
tools.description:
Delete the Model Context Protocol endpoint data.

This tool deletes data at the Model Context Protocol (MCP) endpoint, which supports Streamable HTTP transport. Use it to remove existing configurations or data tied to this endpoint.

tools.name: DeleteSecretById
tools.description:
Deletes a secret using its unique ID.

Use this tool to delete a specific secret identified by its ID. Useful when needing to permanently remove a secret from the system.

parameters.name: secret_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the secret to delete.

tools.name: DeleteUserAuthConnection
tools.description:
Deletes a user/auth provider connection.

This tool deletes a connection between a user and an authentication provider. It should be called when a user needs to disconnect their account from an external auth provider.

parameters.name: connection_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the user/auth provider connection to be deleted.

tools.name: DeleteWorker
tools.description:
Deletes a specified worker from the system.

Use this tool to remove a worker by providing their unique ID. It should be called when you need to permanently delete a worker record from the system.

parameters.name: worker_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the worker to be deleted.

tools.name: ExecuteTool
tools.description:
Execute a specified tool with given parameters.

This tool allows the execution of a specified tool by providing its name and necessary arguments. It's useful for triggering specific actions or processes as dictated by the tool's logic.

Note: Understanding the request schema is necessary to properly create
the stringified JSON input object for execution.

Modes:
- GET_REQUEST_SCHEMA: Returns the schema. Only call if you don't
  already have it. Do NOT call repeatedly if you already received
  the schema.
- EXECUTE: Performs the operation with the provided request body
  JSON.

If you need the schema, call with mode='get_request_schema' ONCE, then execute.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Operation mode: 'get_request_schema' returns the OpenAPI spec for the request body, 'execute' performs the actual operation

parameters.name: request_body
parameters.description: Stringified JSON representing the request body. Required when mode is 'execute', ignored when mode is 'get_request_schema'

tools.name: FetchToolsPage
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of tools for a specific worker.

This tool is used to get a list of tools associated with a specific worker ID. It should be called when you need an overview of tools for a particular worker.

parameters.name: worker_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of the worker for which to retrieve the tools list.

parameters.name: number_of_items
parameters.description: Number of items to return in the result set. Default is 25 and the maximum is 100.

parameters.name: start_offset
parameters.description: Offset from the start of the list for pagination. Defaults to 0.

tools.name: GetAuthProviderDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details of a specific authentication provider.

Use this tool to obtain the details of a particular authentication provider by specifying its ID.

parameters.name: auth_provider_id
parameters.description: The ID of the authentication provider to retrieve.

tools.name: GetFormattedToolSpecification
tools.description:
Fetches a formatted specification for a given tool.

Use this to obtain detailed, formatted specifications for a specific tool from a provider.

parameters.name: tool_name
parameters.description: The name of the tool for which the formatted specification is requested.

parameters.name: provider_format
parameters.description: Specifies the format of the tool as required by the provider.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The identifier for the user requesting the tool specification. This should be a string.

tools.name: GetOpenapiSpecification
tools.description:
Get the OpenAPI 3.0 specification in JSON format.

Use this tool to retrieve the OpenAPI 3.0 specification for the Arcade Engine API, which provides detailed information about all available endpoints and their usage.

output.description: Response from the API endpoint 'openapi' (returns OpenAPI 3.0 specification).

tools.name: GetProjectDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific project.

This tool fetches and returns detailed information for a given project based on its ID. Use it when you need to access specific details about a project.

parameters.name: authorization_token
parameters.description: JWT token required for authentication. Should be provided in the format: 'Bearer <token>'.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the project to retrieve details for. This should be a string matching the project's ID in the database.

tools.name: GetScheduledToolDetails
tools.description:
Retrieve details for a specific scheduled tool execution.

Use this tool to get information about a specific tool execution that has been scheduled, based on its unique identifier. It provides insights into the timing and parameters of the execution.

parameters.name: scheduled_execution_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the scheduled tool execution to retrieve details for.

tools.name: GetScheduledToolExecutions
tools.description:
Fetch a list of scheduled tool executions.

Use this tool to retrieve a page of scheduled tool executions, useful for monitoring upcoming automated processes.

parameters.name: items_limit
parameters.description: The number of scheduled tool executions to return. Defaults to 25, max is 100.

parameters.name: list_offset
parameters.description: The starting position in the list of scheduled tool executions, default is 0.

tools.name: GetToolsList
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of tools from the engine configuration.

Use this tool to get a paginated list of tools available in the engine configuration, with optional filtering by toolkit.

parameters.name: include_formats
parameters.description: List of tool formats to include in the response, specified by their names.

parameters.name: items_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of tools to return, with a maximum of 100. Defaults to 25 if not specified.

parameters.name: start_offset
parameters.description: Offset to determine the starting point from the list of tools. Default is 0.

parameters.name: toolkit_name
parameters.description: Specifies the name of the toolkit to filter the tools list.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The ID of the user requesting the tool list. It is used to filter the results for a specific user context.

tools.name: GetToolSpecification
tools.description:
Retrieve the specification for a specific arcade tool.

This tool returns the arcade tool specification for a specified tool by its name. It should be called when there's a need to understand the details or capabilities of a particular tool.

parameters.name: tool_name
parameters.description: The name of the tool whose specification is to be retrieved. This should match the tool's registered name.

parameters.name: formats_to_include
parameters.description: List of tool formats to include in the response. Provide formats as a list of strings.

parameters.name: user_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the user requesting the tool specification.

tools.name: GetWorkerById
tools.description:
Retrieve worker details using their ID.

Use this tool to obtain detailed information about a worker by providing their unique ID. Ideal for situations where specific worker data is required.

parameters.name: worker_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the worker to retrieve details.

tools.name: GetWorkerHealthStatus
tools.description:
Retrieve the health status of a worker.

This tool is used to check the health status of a specific worker by their ID. It should be called when you need to monitor or verify the operational status of a worker.

parameters.name: worker_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the worker whose health status you want to check.

tools.name: ListAccessibleProjects
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of accessible projects.

This tool returns all projects that the caller has access to. It is useful for identifying projects available to a specific user or account.

parameters.name: bearer_token
parameters.description: A string containing the Bearer (JWT) token for authentication.

parameters.name: items_to_skip
parameters.description: The number of projects to skip before starting to collect the result set.

parameters.name: maximum_items_to_return
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of projects to return. Must be an integer.

tools.name: ListAuthConnections
tools.description:
Retrieve all authentication connections for users.

Use this tool to get a comprehensive list of all authentication connections associated with users. Ideal for managing or auditing user authentication setups.

parameters.name: page_offset
parameters.description: The starting point in the list for pagination. Useful for retrieving subsequent pages of data.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of auth connections to return per page. Use to control the size of the result set.

parameters.name: provider_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the authentication provider.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the user to list authentication connections for.

tools.name: ListAvailableAuthProviders
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of available authentication providers.

This tool fetches a paginated list of authentication providers accessible to the caller. It should be used when identifying or managing auth providers in the system.

tools.name: ListWorkers
tools.description:
Retrieve a list of all workers with their definitions.

Use this tool to get information about all available workers and their definitions. This can be helpful for managing or reviewing the current worker pool.

parameters.name: number_of_items_to_return
parameters.description: The maximum number of worker items to return, with a default of 25 and a maximum of 100.

parameters.name: start_offset
parameters.description: Offset from the start of the list for pagination. Defaults to 0.

tools.name: RetrieveFormattedToolsList
tools.description:
Fetches a formatted list of tools from engine configuration.

Use this tool to retrieve a page of tools from the engine's configuration, which can be filtered by toolkit and formatted for a specific provider.

parameters.name: filter_by_toolkit
parameters.description: Specify the toolkit name to filter the list of tools.

parameters.name: number_of_items_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the number of tools to return. Defaults to 25, with a maximum of 100.

parameters.name: offset_start_index
parameters.description: Offset from the start of the tools list. Default is 0.

parameters.name: provider_format
parameters.description: Format the tools according to the provider's specifications. Accepts a string value.

parameters.name: user_identifier
parameters.description: The ID of the user for whom the tool list is to be retrieved.

tools.name: TestWorkerConnection
tools.description:
Test a worker connection before adding it to the system.

Use this tool to verify if a worker connection is functioning properly before integrating it into your system.

parameters.name: worker_connection_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of worker connection to test. It must be a string value indicating the category or mode of the worker.

parameters.name: http_uri
parameters.description: Specify the HTTP URI of the worker to test the connection.

parameters.name: mcp_uri
parameters.description: The URI for the MCP connection required to test a worker connection.

tools.name: UpdateSessionVerificationSettings
tools.description:
Update session verification settings for a user.

This tool updates the session verification settings for the user or entity making the call. It should be used when there's a need to modify how sessions are verified, reflecting any new security or configuration preferences.

parameters.name: unsafe_skip_verification
parameters.description: Set to true to skip the session verification, making it unsafe.

parameters.name: verifier_url
parameters.description: The URL of the verifier service used for session verification. Provide a valid URL.

documentationChunks.content:
This MCP Server requires the `ARCADE_API_KEY` secret to be configured. Without it, requests to the Arcade Engine will fail.
</Callout>

**Getting your Arcade API Key**

- To use the Arcade Engine API MCP Server, you need an Arcade API key. This key authenticates your requests to the Arcade Engine.
- Learn how to create and manage your Arcade API keys in the [API Keys documentation](/get-started/setup/api-keys).
- Configure the `ARCADE_API_KEY` secret in your MCP Server settings as described in the [configure secrets](/guides/create-tools/tool-basics/create-tool-secrets) guide.

<Callout type="info">
Ensure the secret name is exactly `ARCADE_API_KEY` and that the value is kept secure. Rotate keys regularly and update the MCP secret when keys are replaced.

summary:
The Arcade Engine API toolkit provides developers with the ability to seamlessly integrate language models (LLMs) with the Arcade Engine API, enabling dynamic interactions and tool management.

**Capabilities**
- Authorize users and workers for specific tools.
- Retrieve detailed information about tools, projects, and workers.
- Monitor health statuses of the Arcade Engine and workers.
- Execute tools with specified parameters and manage scheduled executions.
- Manage user authentication connections and configurations.

**OAuth**
There is no OAuth authentication for this toolkit.

**Secrets**
Utilize the `ARCADE_API_KEY` to access secure endpoints and manage sensitive operations within the system.
